name: Path T Melanoma Epiglottis Anterior
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore, T1 and T2 are omitted, as are Stages I and II. 

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes:
\* T4 [NOS] is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4 [NOS].
\# TX, T0 and T4 [NOS] are not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
rows:
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess T
    Surgical resection of primary tumor, extension not stated 
Physician assigns pTX, no other information available to determine T
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor extension involving mucosa of: 
     Adjacent subsite(s) of oropharynx
     Adjacent subsite(s) of supraglottis (including posterior surface of epiglottis) WITHOUT fixation of larynx
     Anterior surface of epiglottis with normal vocal cord mobility
     Base of tongue WITHOUT fixation of larynx
     Larynx, glottis or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx
     Pyriform sinus, medial wall or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx
     Vallecula WITHOUT fixation of larynx 

Buccal mucosa
Mucosa of floor of mouth
Mucosa of gum (gingival)

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

Involvement of deep tissue or musculature
